summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by DOJ OIG Senior Special Agents with Federal Bureau of Prisons Associate Warden . The interview focuses on the circumstances surrounding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, including cellmate requirements, staff rounds, camera system failures, and institutional procedures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate who died by suicide in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York on August 10, 2019. The interview extensively discusses the circumstances of his death, cellmate requirements, and institutional failures.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate during a July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was placed on suicide watch. The witness states Tartaglione was selected as a cellmate because he was former law enforcement and did not appear to pose a threat.

persons.name: Ifrain
persons.context: Another cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein in the SHU after he was removed from suicide watch. The witness recalls this name but is unsure if he was Epstein's consistent cellmate.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: SHU officer on duty the morning Epstein was found. The interview discusses whether she, as the quarterly-assigned SHU officer, should have known Epstein required a cellmate and that she and Michael Thomas did not conduct rounds.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Staff member working overtime in the SHU with Tova Noel when Epstein was found. He entered Epstein's cell immediately upon finding him unresponsive.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Former Warden of MCC New York. The witness emailed him documentation gathered after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Ray Ormond
persons.context: BOP Regional Director who contacted Warden N'Diaye on August 10, 2019, questioning discrepancies in SHU inmate counts.

persons.name: Hughwon Daniel
persons.context: MCC electronics technician responsible for the camera system. The interview discusses whether he was notified of and failed to fix camera recording issues prior to Epstein's death.

persons.name: Leonardo Fernandes
persons.context: Inmate whose improper key-out from the SHU on August 9, 2019, led to inaccurate inmate counts, which Regional Director Ormond questioned.

persons.name: Nobile
persons.context: MCC Facilities Manager, second-line supervisor of Hughwon Daniel. He was out of the office the week of Epstein's death.

connections.description: Epstein and Tartaglione were cellmates in the SHU. An incident on July 23, 2019, led to Epstein being placed on suicide watch.
Ifrain was another inmate who served as Epstein's cellmate in the SHU after he was removed from suicide watch.
Both were the two SHU staff members on the morning watch shift when Epstein was found dead. They admitted to not conducting required rounds.
Daniel was the electronics technician; Nobile was his second-line supervisor as Facilities Manager.
Warden N'Diaye was contacted by Regional Director Ormond regarding count discrepancies on the day of Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt/SHUC Incident
events.description: Incident in the SHU where cellmate Tartaglione called for assistance, indicating Epstein was attempting suicide with a ligature. Epstein was removed from the SHU and placed on suicide watch, then psychological observation.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was removed from suicide watch/psychological observation and placed back in the SHU. Psychology recommended he have a cellmate at all times.

events.title: Ifrain Transferred Out (WAB)
events.description: Inmate Ifrain, Epstein's cellmate, was transferred out of MCC with all belongings (WAB), leaving Epstein without a cellmate contrary to psychology's requirement.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his SHU cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. CPR was initiated, and he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. Staff Tova Noel and Michael Thomas did not conduct required rounds.

events.title: Camera System Failure Identified
events.description: SIS Lieutenant and Associate Warden attempted to review video footage and discovered they could not rewind, indicating a problem with the camera recording system. They involved Comtech Hughwon Daniel.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
FCC Forrest City, Forrest City, Arkansas (witness's current duty station)

keyFacts: Psychology recommended Jeffrey Epstein have a cellmate at all times after his removal from suicide watch on July 30, 2019.

On August 9, 2019, Epstein's cellmate Ifrain was transferred out of MCC (With All Belongings/WAB), leaving Epstein alone. SHU staff were aware of the transfer but failed to ensure he received a new cellmate or notify a lieutenant.
SHU officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, who were on duty when Epstein was found, admitted to not conducting required rounds and counts on August 9-10, 2019.
The MCC camera recording system had failed prior to Epstein's death. Comtech Hughwon Daniel knew the system was down but did not adequately notify supervisors or fix it in time.
New camera system components had been on site at MCC since October 2018 but were not installed until after Epstein's death in August 2019.
